content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 7 to node 1 is:

7 -> 3 -> 12 -> 1

In the graph, the shortest path between any two nodes is the path with the fewest nodes, where each step involves no backward or horizontal movements (i.e., where moving right, up, down, or forward in the path takes you closer to the target). The above path uses 3 intermediate nodes, whereas any other path between node 7 and node 1 would require more nodes.

The shortest path from node 7 to node 12 is:

7 -> 3 -> 5 -> 12

In this case, the shortest path involves fewer nodes than any other path between nodes 7 and 12. Note that this path includes a change of direction from node 3 to node 5, which is considered a single step in the shortest path calculation.
